summary: This document is a chain of emails between officials at the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS) and the Office of the Deputy Attorney General (ODAG) discussing coordination regarding the Epstein/Maxwell case. The emails focus on identifying points of contact and procedures for obtaining hard-copy documents from the Southern District of Florida (SDFL) related to the earlier Epstein investigation and the CVRA litigation, in anticipation of the Ghislaine Maxwell prosecution.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Named as the recently charged defendant in the case, which is prompting the document coordination efforts discussed in the emails.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Referenced as the subject of the prior SDFL investigation and NPA; his death had previously mooted discovery requests.

connections.description: Maxwell is charged in connection with Epstein's activities, as indicated by the email discussing document requests for the Maxwell case in relation to the prior Epstein investigation.

events.title: Ghislaine Maxwell Charged
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York recently charged Ghislaine Maxwell, prompting renewed efforts to obtain documents from the prior Epstein investigation.

events.title: Epstein's Death
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein's death is noted as having previously mooted document and discovery requests related to the SDFL investigation and the Non-Prosecution Agreement (NPA).

events.title: Coordination Call Scheduled
events.description: Officials from USANYS and ODAG schedule a phone call for July 23, 2020, at noon to discuss document location issues related to the Epstein/Maxwell case.

keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS) is actively seeking hard-copy materials from the Southern District of Florida (SDFL) related to the prior Jeffrey Epstein investigation, in connection with the recent charges against Ghislaine Maxwell.
The emails indicate prior coordination on document requests was mooted by Jeffrey Epstein's death, but has been revived due to the Maxwell prosecution.
Officials reference the CVRA (Crime Victims' Rights Act) litigation and a significant document collection conducted by OPR (Office of Professional Responsibility) the previous year (2019).

The correspondence shows internal DOJ coordination between the Southern District of New York, the Office of the Deputy Attorney General (ODAG), and the Southern District of Florida regarding evidence sharing and document custodians.
